channel.title: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox
channel.description:
Please advice, how can I configure 2 whonix gateways and workstations in one virtualbox?
workstation1 --> gateway1 workstation2 --> gateway2
I changed the IP for eth1 interface in gateway2, and used it as a "gateway" in workstation2 network card settings, also I've used new IP for the network card of workstation2 to avoid ip address conflict, but the traffic was still running through gateway1.
How can I configure it properly?

item.title: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox
item.dc:creator: whonixuser9
item.description:
Unfortunately, the scheme I’ve described in my first post doesn’t work even after reading the manuals.
Could anyone assist me with configuring such system.
The problem described in my initial post is still actual.

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox

item.title: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi whonixuser9

Both answers can be found here:

Whonix

Multiple Whonix-Workstations

Compartmentalization. Better separation of different tasks and/or pseudonyms by using multiple Whonix-Workstations.

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox

item.title: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox
item.dc:creator: whonixuser9
item.description:
Please advice, how can I configure 2 whonix gateways and workstations in one virtualbox?

workstation1 --> gateway1
workstation2 --> gateway2

I changed the IP for eth1 interface in gateway2, and used it as a “gateway” in workstation2 network card settings, also I’ve used new IP for the network card of workstation2 to avoid ip address conflict, but the traffic was still running through gateway1.

How can I configure it properly?

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple whonix gateways in one Virtualbox
